message_1: An object with mass 0.1 kg is traveling at a speed of 0.9c (c = speed of light). Calculate the relativistic kinetic energy of the object.
message_2:
To calculate the relativistic kinetic energy of an object, we can use the following formula:

K = (γ - 1)mc^2

where K is the kinetic energy, γ (gamma) is the Lorentz factor, m is the mass of the object, and c is the speed of light.

First, we need to find the Lorentz factor (γ) using the formula:

γ = 1 / sqrt(1 - v^2/c^2)

where v is the speed of the object and c is the speed of light.

In this case, v = 0.9c, so we have:

γ = 1 / sqrt(1 - (0.9c)^2/c^2)
γ = 1 / sqrt(1 - 0.81)
γ = 1 / sqrt(0.19)
γ ≈ 2.294

Now we can calculate the relativistic kinetic energy:

K = (γ - 1)mc^2
K = (2.294 - 1)(0.1 kg)(3 x 10^8 m/s)^2
K ≈ 1.294(0.1 kg)(9 x 10^16 m^2/s^2)
K ≈ 1.1646 x 10^16 J

So the relativistic kinetic energy of the object is approximately 1.1646 x 10^16 Joules.
